intro: Galium triflorum, commonly known as three-flowered bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers, typically in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium triflorum is often found in moist soils and is an important component of understory vegetation in forest ecosystems.
